boardgame.name: Longhorn
boardgame.description: 1870 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Somewhere deep in Texas, the rearing of Longhorn cattle from northern Mexico is booming. It has now become a major source of income for the Texan farmers, while at the same time attracting cattle thieves of all kinds._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Longhorn, the players assume the roles of two particularly feared outlaws: Eagle Perkins and Jessie Artist Byrd. The aim of the game is simple: to steal cattle (and a few gold nuggets, if possible) to see who can amass the most money by the end of the game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; or who can get his opponent arrested by the sheriff!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is set up by shuffling the 9 locations and setting them up in a 3x3 grid, selecting 9 tokens randomly and assigning one to each location (if the sheriff token is in play, it must be placed on Nugget Hill), and finally randomly distributing the coloured longhorn cattle meeples to each location, with the number required being shown on each location. The start player then chooses a location with 4 cattle and places the player piece in it._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends in one of three ways:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- If a player takes the sheriff token, they lose immediately_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- If a player takes all 9 cattle of any one colour, they win immediately (if they did both in the same turn, they lose)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- If no legal move can be made, the players score; gold nugget tokens are worth their face value and each colour of longhorn is worth $100 for each cow of the same colour still on the board. For example, if the Perkins player has 4 black cattle and 5 are left on the board, each of his 4 black longhorns are worth $500. If there are no black cattle (because the Byrd player has them, or through drought) then they are worth nothing. The player with the highet total wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On a players turn, they choose a colour of longhorn present in their location and steal all of that colour. For each longhorn stolen, the player moves the player piece that many spaces and then flips it, to signify that it is now the other player's turn._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If a location is cleared of longhorn cattle, the player who took the last longhorn must take the token present and activate it. Some are positive and some are negative. Once a space is cleared, it can not be moved to in a future turn, though it can be moved through._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Played once. Item is in very good condition. I treat my games very well. If there are components inside the game they are most likely bagged in 4mm, thick bags. I ship via USPS, which is most cost effective. When I ship things I take extra measurers to mitigate any potential shipping damage. Shipping from 98012. Here’s some shipping ESTIMATES to help you get an idea of what it will cost. Your distance from my Zip Code (98012) and box weight are the biggest factors in price. Please ask ahead of time if you want to know your shipping! If you place an order and cancel it after I provide you with shipping, you will get negative feedback. Small Card Game (i.e. 6 nimmt or Hanabi) $3-$6 / USPS First Class or Priority Bubble Mailer Thin Medium Sized (i.e. Concept, Las Vegas) $8-$10 / Priority Mail Thick Medium Sized (i.e. Istanbul, King of Tokyo, Russian Railroads) $10-$13 / Priority Mail Big Box Games (i.e. Ticket to Ride, 7 Wonders) $16-$18 / Priority Mail or Parcel Post Oversized or Odd Shaped Boxes ($22-$25) / Parcel Post

Reserved for psich7 for pickup at Gen Con Please submit payment via PayPal, Google Wallet or Venmo to gramaw@gmail.com. Alternatively, you may pay, via one of these methods or COD, directly at the convention. Since I am selling so many games I plan to meet as many buyers as possible on Saturday morning at 9AM outside of hall A on level 1 of the convention center, near room 128 (this was the former location of multiple Gen Con Math trade meetups, in case you are familiar.) You can find a link to a map of the denoted area here: https://boardgamegeek.com/image/4236187/gramaw If at all possible please meet me at this time and location. If this will not be possible, please Geekmail me so we can make an alternative arrangement. Lastly, my phone number is 847.454.6369 if you need to reach me at the convention.

SELLERS TERMS AND CONDITIONS: PAYMENT TERMS: Payment is due within 2 days of the date you placed the order. Please do not purchase if you do not intend to follow through with the transaction. PAYMENT METHODS: PayPal SHIPPING: Buyer is responsible for all shipping cost. All orders are shipping Priority Mail. RETURNS: All returns require authorization BEFORE returning the item. We will accept returns within 5 days of your receipt of the order. We only accept returns on items which are in their original condition. Original condition means, the game have not been played and all parts are in the same condition as they were when you received the game. We only refund shipping costs if the return is a result of our error. If you refuse delivery of an order, we will deduct the return shipping charge from your refund.

Games are brand new, and unopened. The buyer pays shipping. I accept Square, but prefer Paypal. Ship to anywhere in US using USPS flat rate boxes. If you purchase multiple items from me, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll package them all together to reduce shipping costs whenever possible. To estimate shipping: https://postcalc.usps.com/ • Use medium box (this gives you a better average price; I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll charge you the actual cost for shipping.) • I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m shipping from 94534. Local pickup also available in Fairfield, Vacaville, Suisun City, and Davis, CA.
